The narrator didn't mention that all skin creams must also contain a preservative. Any cosmetic product which includes water requires a preservative. Beware of purchasing creams that contain mineral oil. It is an 'occlusive' so blocks almost all the air from the skin, causing it to dry. This is why cheap lip salves make your lips drier over time. The air is prevented from reaching the lips (or skin, if its in cream). While the more expensive creams use natural oils and expensive ingredients, the cheap products use synthetic mineral oil because it doesn't go rancid over time when sitting on the supermarket shelf. Its inclusion is to protect the company from financial loss and has nothing to do with skin benefits. I made skin creams and natural body products to sell in markets, so have done quite a bit of research on this subject.

Used to use this stuff on patients in hospitals and nursing homes. It was wonderful for thin delicate dry skin or the skin of a chemo patient. Worked wonders on the nurse's hands, and feels very cool and relieving on sunburns.
Edit to add: We used the round lidded tubs because the formula contains allantoin which the hand cream does not. Allantoin is the active substance in Comfrey that lets it knit flesh so fast it can stop internal bleeding. Note: due to updates in science about 30 years ago, comfrey/allantoin are now known to be strictly for EXTERNAL USE ONLY but in the past comfrey tea was widely used among herbalists and country doctors to help treat injuries and stop internal bleeding.
